title: MPs support EU referendum plan
desc: British MPs vote overwhelmingly in favour of holding a referendum on whether the UK should remain a member of the European Union.

title: Wanted Fifa suspect hands himself in
desc: Argentine sports marketing executive Alejandro Burzaco sought by police in connection with the Fifa bribery scandal hands himself in to police in Italy.

title: 'Russian hackers' behind TV attack
desc: A cyber attack on a the French television network TV5 Monde may have been carried out by Russian-based hackers police believe.

title: Footage reveals IS regime in Mosul
desc: The brutality and oppression of life under IS is revealed by exclusive video and testimony from Iraq's second city of Mosul a year after it fell.

title: Man freed after 43 years in solitary
desc: A judge in the US state of Louisiana orders the release of a man who has been in solitary confinement for more than four decades.

title: Nemtsov daughter attacks Russia media
desc: A daughter of murdered Russian opposition politician Boris Nemtsov accuses pro-Kremlin media of spreading hateful propaganda and says she has left Russia to live in exile.

title: Iraq bomb attacks kill at least 18
desc: A series of bomb attacks in and around the Iraqi capital Baghdad leaves at least 18 people dead as violence continues to plague the country.

title: US 'sent live anthrax to UK'
desc: A lab in the UK may have accidentally received a sample of live anthrax from the Pentagon in 2007 say US officials.

title: Syria rebels seize major army base
desc: Rebels in Syria say they have captured a major army base in the south of the country the latest in a string of defeats suffered by the government.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi to visit China
desc: Aung San Suu Kyi Myanmar's opposition leader is to visit China for the first time at a time of tension between the two countries.

title: Greece submits new reform plan to EU
desc: Cash-strapped Greece submits a revised reform plan to the European Union and International Monetary Fund.

title: Malaysia Airlines to be 'new company'
desc: Malaysian Airlines will become an entirely new company its new boss has said in an interview with the BBC

title: VIDEO: Malaysia Airlines 'to be replaced'
desc: The new CEO of Malaysia Airlines has moved to reassure the families of last year's twin Malaysia Airlines disasters that the company's rebranding will not affect them.

title: VIDEO: Storm chasers film anti-cyclonic tornado
desc: A US storm chaser has captured footage of a large anti-cyclonic tornado swirling over fields in Colorado.

title: VIDEO: What's solitary confinement like?
desc: A released member of the 'Angola 3' tells the BBC solitary confinement makes inmates old before their time.

title: VIDEO: Remains of T-Rex cousin go on show
desc: A fossilised skeleton of a meat-eating Jurassic dinosaur found on a south Wales beach is put on show for the first time.

title: VIDEO: German churches sheltering refugees
desc: A ancient legal loophole to shelter migrants on church land is being put into practice in Germany.

title: VIDEO: Mumbai bans horse-drawn carriages
desc: A court in India has ruled that Mumbai's famous horse-drawn carriages popularly known as Victorias are illegal and must go off the city streets in a year.

title: VIDEO: Free-runner climbs Wembley arch
desc: A 24-year-old free-runner from Southampton has climbed to the top of the Wembley stadium arch.

title: VIDEO: 'You think I'm funny? I'm a politician'
desc: US TV host Jon Stewart asks Nicola Sturgeon about independence oil and haggis as she appears on The Daily Show.

title: Was G7 summit worth the effort and expense?
desc: Striking images powerful rhetoric eye-catching proposals - the G7 summit at Schloss Elmau in Germany had all those but was it worth the effort and the expense?

title: Fifa scandal: SA nerves unsettled?
desc: A steady leak of emails is doing little to calm nerves surrounding the allegation that the vote for the host of the 2010 World Cup was rigged.

title: Will new strategy defeat Boko Haram?
desc: Nigeria moves its military command centre to the north-east city of Maiduguri as President Buhari launches a new strategy to defeat Boko Haram.

title: Will Nepal's earthquake bring historic change?
desc: Political leaders in Nepal have signed a deal on a new constitution. Could April's devastating earthquake be a catalyst for historic change?

title: VIDEO: Is life improving for African women?
desc: The African Union summit is taking place in South Africa focusing on women's development and empowerment. But what has changed for women since 2002?

title: Is gas the clean energy of the future?
desc: The gas industry is trying to rebrand itself away from fossil fuels and towards renewables but what role is it really going to play in a clean energy future?

title: Automated cameras record Serengeti life
desc: Hundreds of automated cameras capture day-to-day animal life in the Serengeti of Tanzania.

title: School's £1650 Barbados sport trip
desc: A West Yorkshire school is criticised for asking parents to pay £1650 for a school trip to Barbados.

title: Alibaba boss in US charm offensive
desc: The boss of the Chinese internet firm Alibaba Jack Ma tells the US we need more American products for China.

title: HSBC to cut 8000 jobs in the UK
desc: HSBC Europe's biggest bank has announced plans to cut up to 25000 jobs globally and rename its UK branches.

title: Facebook offers free beacon devices
desc: Facebook begins a roll-out of Place Tips - a system allowing businesses to send updates to a person's smartphone when they are nearby.

title: Baidu to launch self-drive car
desc: Chinese web giant Baidu will launch its own self-driving car in the second half of this year it has confirmed.

title: Sam Smith 'relieved' to speak again
desc: Sam Smith says he's so relieved that he can speak again after having surgery on his vocal cords.

title: Radio 1 'not scared' of Apple radio
desc: Radio 1 boss says he is 'not scared' of Apple's new radio station Beats 1 and other industry reaction to the launch.

title: 'Blood cells' found in dino fossils
desc: Researchers have discovered what appear to be the remnants of red blood cells and connective tissue in 75 million-year-old dinosaur fossils.

title: Active cities 'boost bottom lines'
desc: Cities that actively promote physical activities enjoy increased economic activity and reduced healthcare and crime costs research suggests.

title: Artificial leg allows patient to feel
desc: Scientists in Austria have created an artificial leg which allows the amputee to feel lifelike sensations from their foot.

title: Stroke patients tricked into health
desc: Virtual reality could help stroke patients recover by tricking them into thinking their affected limb is more accurate than it really is researchers find.

title: England thrash NZ after record score
desc: England make a sensational start to their new era by smashing their highest ever one-day score against New Zealand at Edgbaston.

title: France women 1-0 England women
desc: England slip to a 1-0 defeat in their opening Women's World Cup match against France in Moncton Canada.

title: How Jaws misrepresented the great white
desc: The film Jaws has shaped the way many of us view sharks - but the creatures don't deserve their vicious reputation writes Mary Colwell.

title: The many groups that have copied Alcoholics Anonymous
desc: Alcoholics Anonymous was founded 80 years ago. It has spawned a host of other groups dealing with every manner of compulsion.

title: Statue's glow-in-the-dark eyes mocked
desc: Controversy over new statue of Bulgaria's 10th-Century ruler.

title: Students get 'alternative' homework
desc: Teacher tells students to use summer for contemplation.

title: Eritrea accuses UN of 'vile slander'
desc: Eritrea's government dismisses as a vile slander a UN report accusing it of human rights violations on a scale seldom witnessed elsewhere.

title: HK Mers warning over S Korea travel
desc: Hong Kong issues a warning against travel to South Korea which is battling a deadly outbreak of Middle East Respiratory Syndromes (Mers).

title: Turkey PM resigns but stays in power
desc: Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu has resigned in a procedural move after his governing AK Party lost its majority in parliamentary elections.

title: Panama ex-leader faces wiretap probe
desc: Panama's ex-President Ricardo Martinelli will be investigated over allegations he ordered illegal wiretaps during his time in office.

title: Football riot death sentences upheld
desc: An Egyptian court upholds 11 men's death sentences over football stadium violence in Port Said in 2012 which left 74 people dead.

title: Police officer shot dead in Canada
desc: Police in Alberta Canada say a British-born police officer working for the Edmonton Police force has been shot dead carrying out an arrest.

title: Owner of baby-maul death dog jailed
desc: The owner of a dog that mauled an 11-month-old baby to death is jailed for 18 weeks after he is found guilty of owning a banned breed.

title: £1bn tidal lagoon given go-ahead
desc: The building of a £1bn tidal lagoon in Swansea Bay is given the go-ahead by the UK government.

title: Teen 'was being blackmailed online'
desc: Police are investigating whether a schoolboy believed to have taken his own life after being tricked into posting pictures online was being blackmailed.

title: Naked rambler appears nude in court
desc: Stephen Gough who is known as the naked rambler appears via video link with no clothes on at the Court of Appeal.
